clinical_study.brief_title: Presentation, Clinical Course and Patterns of Myocardial Damage Due to Viral Myocarditis
clinical_study.official_title: Presentation, Clinical Course and Patterns of Myocardial Damage Due to Viral Myocarditis

brief_summary.textblock: Presentation, Clinical Course and Patterns of Myocardial Damage due to Viral Myocarditis

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Determine the pattern of myocarditis in hospitalized patients with acute HF within the last 3 months.
2. Determine the pattern of broad spectrum cardiotropic viruses in patients with acute HF within the last 3 months. These viruses like enteroviruses, adenoviruses and parvo B19 virus, HBV, HCV and Covid 19 virus due to its increased prevelance nowadays.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine the pattern of myocarditis in hospitalized patients with acute HF within the last 3 months
primary_outcome.description: All patients admitted with symptoms , signs and echocardiographic finding suggesting myocarditis within 3 months from start of the symptoms. as acute heart failure, arrhythmias, typical chest pain with ST segment deviation in ECG . dilated cardiomyopathy associated with normal Coronary Angiography, history of upper respiratory tract infection within the last 3 months. All will be investigated for determine the pattern of viral myocarditis in those patients

secondary_outcome.description: 1. Determine the pattern of broad spectrum cardiotropic viruses in patients with acute HF within the last 3 months. These viruses like enteroviruses, adenoviruses and parvo B19 virus, HBV, HCV and Covid 19 virus due to its increased prevelance nowadays.

arm_group.description: All patients admitted with unexplained heart failure in the last 3 months will be investigated for viral myocarditis by the use of 12 lead ECG, echocardiography, Cardiac MRI , coronary angiography, Endomyocardial biopsy ( optional ), serological tests including ELIZA,Extraction of nucleic acid, Determination of viral genome by using PCR., Quantitative real-time PCR to assess viral load, Immunohistochemistry analysis of EMB.

study_pop.textblock: All patients complained of symptoms of moderate to severe heart disease including atypical chest pain, fatigue, reduced physical capacity, recently occurring cardiac arrhythmia, and/or dyspnea on exertion suggesting myocardial inflammation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: All patients admitted with symptoms , signs and echocardiographic finding suggesting myocarditis within 3 months from start of the symptoms. as acute heart failure, arrhythmias, typical chest pain with ST segment deviation in ECG . dilated cardiomyopathy associated with normal Coronary Angiography, history of upper respiratory tract infection within the last 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with significant coronary artery disease.
2. Patient with family history suggesting familial DCMP
3. Critically ill patients.
4. Patients who refuse to do coronary angiography . .
5. Patients with severe valvular heart disease.
6. Pregnant women
7. Patients with raised renal chemistry.
8. Echocardiographic finding showing LVEDD more than 6.5cm
